content.description: Wet Goddess is a slightly overhanging and pumpy route between Flipper and Stay Golden.
Fallow two parallel water groves up to the top.

Stay Golden starts behind a tree. There is a small section of smooth, white, marble-like rock at the beginning. A large orange streak looms above. Encounter a medium size cavity mid-way up and then climb pockets through the orange streak and get a good rest on a jug before setting off on the vertical crux to some runnels that lead to the anchor.
content.protection: 8 protection bolts and a two-bolt anchor.
content.location: Stay Golden is located in the middle of the first group of five climbs encountered in the lower section of Water World.

content.description: Moderate climbing leads to a short steep section. Stay on the left bolt line. The right bolt line is the more tricky finish to Dolphin Dance.
content.location: Star Kissed a couple of yards right of Stay Golden and begins on the left side of the large tree.

content.description: Moderate climbing leads to some interesting holds on slightly steep terrain.
content.location: Silk Purse is located between Pigs Ear and Flash Flood.

content.description: Furthest left route on wall.
Climb up to the smooth rock and pull the techy overhang.
content.location: Pigs Ear is between Dowsing Rod and Silk Purse.

content.description: Fourth route on wall, going from left to right.
Seventh route on wall, going from left to right.
content.location: Seventh route on wall, going from left to right.

content.description: Sixth route on wall, going from left to right.
content.location: Sixth route on wall, going from left to right.

content.description: A tricky start and thin crux up high.
content.location: Flipper is between The Dolphin and Wet Goddess.

content.description: Third route on wall, going from left to right.
content.location: Third route on wall, going from left to right.

content.description: Climb up to a slightly awkward pillar and make a couple of committing moves to get to the next bolt.
content.location: Dowsing Rod is located between Water Witch and Pigs Ear.

content.description: Start at a marble-floor-like, polished section of rock. Continue up incipient cracks through runnels to the top.
content.protection:
6 bolts to a two bolt anchor. The hangers on the protection bolts are of the Bluewater Bendz variety and have a distinctive curve to them. 

mystery hanger
content.location:
The main Water World complex is arrived at after you hang a right (west) at the junction of the two canyons, scramble up a short arête past an enormous pothole on the right, and pull a bouldery move up some polished slab around a large boulder jam featuring a unique chockstone.  

  The Dolphin is the first route encountered shortly past the boulder jam.  

  There are currently five routes here, side by side. Looking up-canyon, the routes are on the left (south) side and they seem to get shade for most of the day.  

  The routes are listed here L-R   The Dolphin 9   Wet Goddess 10d   Stay Golden 10c   Name Unknown 10b   Dolphin Dance 10c 

  Continuing up-canyon there is a 8 foot scramble up a steep water polished pour-off and then you will encounter the next group of climbs.

content.description: Fun, chill climbing leads to a large ledge. Beware the giant death boulder that is to your right. Above the ledge, the route steepens. Once you pull the crux move, cut right to the anchor.
content.protection: 7 protection bolts and a two-bolt anchor.
content.location:
Dolphin Dance starts in an alcove behind a red bud tree just slightly up-canyon from a little 3 foot tall, polished limestone step-up in the wash. This is the last route encountered in the first group of five climbs in lower Water World. It is on the south side of the canyon and to the right of Stay Golden and Unnamed 5.10a. 

  Travelling further up-canyon beyond Dolphin Dance, you will hit a 6 foot tall scramble up a water-polished pour-off. Beyond this scramble is the next group of climbs (ie., Aquanet, Sea of Oppression, etc.).

climbs.name: The Confluence
climbs.fa: Killis Howard, John Hegyes, Gigi Miller. Sept. 20, 2016.

content.description: This route is between Flash Flood and Inland Sea. Rappel or lower from chains.
content.location: This route is between Flash Flood and Inland Sea.

content.description: Last route on the wall, far right.
Fifth route on wall, going from left to right.

Start climbing at the orange recess through very steep rock. The crux comes pretty quickly. After a rest go first left then traverse right into the V-shaped groove. Rest at the ledge then do some big stemming through runnels to the top.
content.protection: 9 bolts. The anchor is shared with Seas of Oppression.
content.location: The two main areas of Water World are separated by a six foot tall scramble up water polished rock. Aqua Net is just left of Seas of Oppression in the upper section of Water World. Left of Aqua Net are two other routes.

content.description: Eighth route on wall, going from left to right.
content.location: Eighth route on wall, going from left to right.

content.description: A small tight limestone canyon can be found 10 miles west of Lone Mountain. The climbing is sport on sharp gray limestone. Routes are around 30 to 60 feet tall.
